title: Yemen - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: STC: Southern Transitional Council (Security Belt Forces)
STC: Southern Transitional Council (Security Belt Forces)

On 5 February 2021, factions within the STC security belt forces clashed with one another in the Jaar city (Khanfir, Abyan) over control of a security checkpoint in Dofas, resulting in the death of a civilian.
Police Forces of Yemen (2012-) Aden Security
On 5 February 2021, unidentified gunmen clashed with Aden police in the police station in Al Madarah (Ash Shaikh Outhman, Aden), injuring one police officer.
Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council

On 5 February 2021, Houthi forces launched missiles which landed in Sanaa Street, Mashir al-Shaabi neighbourhood and Mashhad neighbourhood in Al Hawak district (Al Hudaydah). No report of fatalities or injuries.
Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council

On 5 February 2021, Houthi forces shelled north and south of At Tuhayta city centre (At Tuhayat, Al Hudaydah) with mortar (120 calibre), machine guns and snipers. National Resistance Forces responded and shelled the Houthi firing positions. No report of fatalities or injuries.
On 5 February 2021, the Saudi-led coalition conducted three airstrikes on southern parts of Al Jah (Bayt Al Faqiah, Al Hudaydah). No report of fatalities or injuries.
Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council

On 5 February 2021, Houthi forces shelled Hays district (Al Hudaydah) with mortars (120 & 82 calibre), RPG, medium weapons (14.5 & 12.7 calibre), PK machine guns and snipers. No report of fatalities or injuries.
Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
On 5 February 2021, National Resistance Forces shelled Houthi forces in Hays district (Al Hudaydah), killing and injuring several Houthis. Unclear number of fatalities, coded as 10.
Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
Military Forces of Saudi Arabia (2015-); Military Forces of Yemen (2012-)
Yafa News; Yemen Press Agency; Yemen Data Project
On 5 February 2021, a Houthi missile targeted the ammunition depot in the At Tadawin military camp (Marib, Marib). No report of fatalities or injuries.
On 5 February 2021, the Saudi-led coalition conducted an airstrike on Zijjan (Sirwah, Marib). No report of fatalities or injuries.

On 5 February 2021, the Saudi-led coalition conducted an airstrike on eastern Mijazah in the Asir sector, coded at Al Mijazah Frontline (Baqim, Sadah). No report of fatalities or injuries. *ACLED defaults to coding the event on the Yemeni side when the source describes a large area along the Saudi-Yemeni border.
Yemen Press Agency; Yemen Data Project
On 5 February 2021, the Saudi-led coalition conducted two missile strikes from an Apache helicopter against Al Far (Kitaf wa Al Boqee, Sadah). No report of fatalities or injuries.
On 5 February 2021, remnants of a airstrike cluster bomb from coalition forces injured three children in Majz district (Sadah).
On 5 February 2021, demonstrators protested in front of the security building in the Ahwar district (Abyan) against rising insecurity in the area. [size=no report]
STC: Southern Transitional Council (Security Belt Forces)

On 5 February 2021, unidentified militants attacked a vehicle transporting a commander in the STC Security Belt Forces in Enma (Al Mansura, Aden). There were no injuries or fatalities, and the reason for the attack was not known.

On 5 February 2021, Muslim groups demonstrated after Friday prayers in multiple districts in the Al Hudaydah governorate against the Saudi-led coalition's military campaign in Yemen, against the embargo on imports to Yemen, and the arrests of women accused of being Houthi spies in Marib. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, tribes from Bayt Rashid and Bayt al Hajiri demonstrated in Hamlan (Hajjah City, Hajjah) against the Saudi-led coalition, UAE, and US military campaigns in Yemen and against the arrests of women accused of being Houthi spies in Marib. [size=no report]

bites.bite: The largest admin1 is Al Hudaydah with 6 reports followed by Sadah with 3 reports.
The largest admin2 is Al Hawak with 2 reports followed by Hays with 2 reports.
The largest admin1 is Al Hudaydah with 10448 reports followed by Sadah with 10440 reports.
The largest admin2 is Baqim with 2379 reports followed by Sirwah with 2336 reports.
